blog.name: acepalindrome
blog.title: you're going to be something extraordinary
blog.description: Hello, this is Palindrome! I'm currently doing my best to pretend that I'm a functional and well adjusted adult, with varying levels of success! Around this neck of the woods you'll find history stuff, nature stuff, whatever fandoms I'm into at the moment, fanfics I write when I can muster up the energy, the occasional mental breakdown and a variety of fun facts I come across or things I find interesting. Feel free to follow or drop me a line, I promise I'm quite tame.

summary: I’m looking forward to finding out what exactly has gotten Caduceus so upset about the latest disaster because I think that will...
body: I’m looking forward to finding out what exactly has gotten Caduceus so upset about the latest disaster because I think that will tell us a lot about him. Is it because he almost died several times? Because the M9 were even more reckless and chaotic than usual? Because they stole a whole pirate ship? Because he might be moving further away from the quest the Wildmother sent him on? There’s probably multiple factors going on here and I’m so excited to finally get to see some of what’s going on in his head because he’s faced down some crazy shit before this and barely blinked, and this is the first time anything has broken through his chill before. I’m hoping for a lot of good character development about all this on Thursday!

I’m hoping for a lot of good character development about all this on Thursday!

blog.name: critrole-imagines
blog.title: this is what we've built with our tiny moments
blog.description: REQUESTS: OPEN! welcome to critrole imagines! i fulfill critical role based writing requests! feel free to send me stuff!

tags: a lot of seaman in this one
my first instinct was to write caleb panicking
summary: ooh ooh ooh! can you do Caleb and Fjord panic?
question: ooh ooh ooh! can you do Caleb and Fjord panic?
answer:
your wish for angst is valid and good

~

By all rules of logic, Fjord should be sleeping better now that they’re on the water. Now that he can feel the waves gently rocking their ship as he drifts off. They always served to calm him before.

But the ocean isn’t the safe place it used to be. And so Fjord dreams of drowning. He’s sinking, his armor pulling him down instead of helping him swim like it should.

He knows this dream, and yet he can’t help but struggle against the dark current tugging at his body, at his mind. He sinks like a stone.

But he doesn’t reach the ocean floor. There’s only darkness underneath. No end to the hungry depths of the creature that is the sea. That is his patron. That is Fjord himself.

He gives up eventually, drifting down, further down into the abyss. The water feels neither warm nor cold. It’s almost as if he’s floating. Breathing feels strange, like inhaling liquid air, but at least he’s not drowning.

Fjord looks up and feels a chill run through his body when he realizes that he’s too far down to even see the sunlight reflected on the surface. There’s only black now. The void.

Briefly, Fjord wonders if this is really a dream, if he didn’t just die in his sleep and this is the afterlife for those who die at sea - but then, finally and abruptly, an eye opens right in front of him. Yellow and massive and terrifying and… powerful.

Fjord summons his falchion without thinking. The eye stares, unblinking as always.

Reward, the voice says inside his head.

Growth. It almost purrs the word and Fjord knows his patron is satisfied with his work. If he only knew what exactly that work is.

“Uh…glad I’m meeting your expectations,” he replies, and he doesn’t hear his own voice, only sees the bubbles it makes. “But I’d still appreciate if I knew what you want me to do.”

The eye narrows. Weakness.

Fjord flinches at the tone, but doesn’t back down. “Tell me what you want from me!”

Consume. Fjord nearly rolls his eyes. He got that part.

But his patron isn’t finished. Allies. It sounds almost disgusted and then repeats: Weakness.

“That’s not true,” Fjord protests immediately, “We help each other.”

Distractions. There’s anger now, real anger, and Fjord can feel it in the water all around. Mine.

He swallows. “No.”

And then the eye is gone. And Fjord is drowning. The water, so easy to breathe until now, is burning in his lungs as he gasps for air where there is none. He kicks wildly, instincts driving him to try for the surface but… he doesn’t know where the surface is. But he keeps trying. And he keeps drowning.

He doesn’t pass out. He should. He should be fucking dead by now. But he’s not dying. Is he cursed to drown here forever, for denying his patron?

It hurts.

And then there’s a voice. Heavily accented words he can’t identify. A blow to his chest. Another. And another.

Fjord coughs. There’s so much water. It’s everywhere. It’s not letting him go. It’s dragging him down, killing him yet leaving him alive to suffer.

He’s turned over onto his side by a pair of rough hands, and he vomits sea water all over the floor. Right. He fell asleep on deck of their ship. With Caleb reading nearby. It was just a dream.

For a couple moments, he can’t do anything but lie there and tremble as he takes gasping breaths. It’s air. Real air. His patron doesn’t have that much power over him.

But it has more power here. Fjord scrambles to his legs. They need to get back to shore. He needs to get away from the ocean, his love, his greatest foe.

But suddenly there’s a pair of arms wrapped around his chest to keep him from moving. Fjord growls angrily and struggles. “Let go!” He needed to change their course. Needed to get away.

“Fjord!” Caleb sounds frightened and worried, and he doesn’t understand. None of them do.

“Let me fucking go, Caleb! We need to- we need to…”

Caleb lets go and Fjord makes it all of three shaky steps before he speaks again.

“I suggest you sit down and get your bearings before you make any decisions.”

The words sink in and, of course, Caleb is right. That sounds much more reasonable than what he was going to do.

Fjord sits down where he is and closes his eyes, taking a couple deep breaths. Still air. Ocean air nonetheless. It’s meant to calm him, but somehow it only serves to remind him of what lies below now.

They’re both silent for a long while. Fjord’s thoughts slow down until he feels he’s almost back to himself. Still a little shaky, but he knows where he is and he knows that he’ll have to give this a little more thought. After all, his patron reached him on land just as well as here.

It’s much later when Fjord trusts his voice enough to speak up. “How do you do it?”

Caleb looks up from his book and furrows his brows in silent question.

Fjord clears his throat. “Cope. With the… the fear. The memories. The panic.” He doesn’t know what happened to Caleb, but he knows it was bad.

Caleb considers him for a moment. Then he turns to look out at the sea. “I don’t,” is his quiet, earnest reply.

No. He doesn’t look like he’s coping.

And neither is Fjord. At least for now.

The Mighty Nein Take Manhattan
In honor of the live show in NYC next week a broadway and Muppet inspired poster of our favorite...
body:
The Mighty Nein Take Manhattan

In honor of the live show in NYC next week a broadway and Muppet inspired poster of our favorite gang taking on the big apple. I wish I still lived on the East coast and could go!

tags: once again tagging communities i think might have a use for this
seriously tho anything goes please just come tell me your best stories
summary: I’m in a Mood again so offer is going out again: Come tell me your D&D stories! I want to hear about the wild and the weird...
body:
I’m in a Mood again so offer is going out again: Come tell me your D&D stories!

I want to hear about the wild and the weird you’ve encountered, the heroes you become, the best betrayals and the worst loyalties, the hardest decisions you’ve made in character…

Telling D&D stories is so much fun but it’s so rare that people genuinely want to hear them and I! Do!  Please come tell me all about your best and worst moments because I’m so invested already I swear

blog.name: tusklovethebook
blog.title: Tusk Love, the Excerpts
blog.description:
THE SECOND SERIES FEATURED IS BY THE TALENTED WALLLFLOWERART

Tusk Love is Tal'Dorei's best-selling romance fiction novel series, first found by Critical Role's the Mighty Nein in the Chastity's Nook in Zadash.

The story of the second novel deals with the beautiful romance between Mizara, a trans half-orc woman with taste for the exotic and strange and Vulri, a hard-hitting go-getter who will stop at nothing to protect the love of her life.

They met on one of Hupperdook's many raves, and fell in love before the sun rose once more...

summary: Finally caught up with the One-Shots!
title: Finally caught up with the One-Shots!
body:
The Song of the Lorelei was really good! Oh man, I miss playing DnD waaaay too much haha.

Tusk Love will begin anew early October! I’m really excited to be bringing you this story! I would like to ask:

Would you like if I kept updating every week a 1-2 page excerpt or full chapter every month?

blog.name: caleb-widogastt
blog.title: Tired, Bi, and Ready To Cry (and/or) Die
blog.description: I'm really bad at updating this, but (so I don't have to for the next 7 years) Late 20s/early 30s Man, if that makes you Uncomfortable, please, I don't mind if you unfollow/block. Come for the Critical Role and other fandom stuff...stay for (not so vague) leftist/socialist propoganda, sadness, and shitty memes.

summary:
Fandom: The Mighy Nein are all terrible people when compared to the virtuous and heroic Vox Machina!
Percy: Shot a prisoner's...
body:
Fandom: The Mighy Nein are all terrible people when compared to the virtuous and heroic Vox Machina!
Percy: Shot a prisoner's hand off for nothing but vindictive reasons.
VM: Dropped a mind controlled Giant to its death for tactical battle reasons.
VM: Entered into an agreement with an evil green dragon and seriously considered letting her go.
Vax: Killed a prisoner with a broken leg.
Percy & Grog: Tortured a prisoner for no reason by pulling out his tongue and burning a symbol into his forehead
VM: Allowed an ally to stay petrified for over a full day to avoid an "I told you so"
Vex: Mocked two different handicapped men (carriage driver whose hand Percy shot off and Tyriok) 
Scanlan: *gestures vaguely at the multiple times he fucked with people's memories for selfish reasons*
VM: stole a friend's magic carpet then lied to her for years about it

And this isn't even touching the fact that Percy literally invented and used firearms despite the knowledge and fear of what the invention could cause in the years and centuries to come. 

This isn't to say Vox Machina is bad or evil or anything of the sort. Just that 1. Morality is often grayer than y'all are willing to admit and 2. By the end Vox Machina might have been Big Damn Heroes but they weren't always that. We don't know what kind of big Chroma Conclave type situation Matt's going to throw at the Nein that may turn them into Legitimate Heroes or if he's even going to. This is just to say to compare a group of chucklefucks who have been adventuring for less than 3 months to the end result of what in game might have been a 10 year story build (we were privied, by my estimation to about a 5 year in world story) is unfair.

This isn't to say Vox Machina is bad or evil or anything of the sort. Just that 1. Morality is often grayer than y'all are willing to admit and 2.
